subdefinitions.definition: To push or thrust (the nose or snout , face or muzzle , or head , or an object ) against or into something.
To rub or touch (someone or something) with the nose, face, etc., or an object.
examples: The horse nuzzled its foal’s head gently to wake him up.
She nuzzled her girlfriend in the cinema.

subdefinitions.definition: Chiefly of an animal : to dig (something, especially food ) out of the ground using the nose or snout; to root .
Often followed by in or into : to press or push the nose or snout, mouth , face, etc., against or into someone or something; to touch someone or something with the nose or snout, etc.
examples: The bird nuzzled up to the wires of the cage.

subdefinitions.definition: Chiefly of an animal: to push the nose or snout into the ground to dig for something, especially food; to root, to rootle .
Followed by down : to settle or lie comfortably and snugly in a bed , nest , etc.; to nestle .
Chiefly followed by up or with : to press affectionately against someone or something; to nestle, to snuggle .
( figurative ) To come into close contact with someone or something.
( obsolete , rare ) To feel or probe with the fingers .

definitions.definition: Often followed by up or with : to nurture or train (oneself or someone) to act a certain way , have certain beliefs , etc.

subdefinitions.definition: To train (a dog or hawk ) to attack prey .

definitions.definition: Chiefly followed by up : to bring up (someone); to foster , to rear ; also, to educate (someone); to train.

To care for (someone) affectionately ; to hold dear (someone); to cherish , to nurse ; also, to provide (someone or something) a comfortable and snug place to settle or lie (compare etymology 1, verb sense 2.3 ) .

main_definition: Often followed by up or with : to nurture or train (oneself or someone) to act a certain way , have certain beliefs , etc.
secondary_definitions: ( generally ) Chiefly followed by up : to bring up (someone); to foster , to rear ; also, to educate (someone); to train.

( literary ) To care for (someone) affectionately ; to hold dear (someone); to cherish , to nurse ; also, to provide (someone or something) a comfortable and snug place to settle or lie (compare etymology 1, verb sense 2.3 ) .
